content: joji locatelli odyssey i started the design of this shawl during a trip to canada inspired by the green colors of the landscape it was the perfect easy project to keep me company on a trip that turned out to be quite an adventure odyssey is a crescent shaped shawl in 3 colors of medium-weight yarn each color section ends with a lace band that features striking big eyelets and wavy texture pick three colors to write your own odyssey with this shawl finished measurements approx 76¾ inches 192 cm from side to side and 18¾ inches 47 cm from top to bottom at deepest point after blocking materials 3 skeins of tosh merino dk by madelinetosh 100% superwash merino 225 yards 206 m /100g or approx 675 yards 618 m of dk weight yarn in 3 colors 1 skein of each the sample was made using colors 1 cactus darkest green 2 joshua tree green 3 pelican gray needles us 8 5 mm needles other notions tapestry needle stitch markers a split ring st marker blocking pins or wires gauge 13 st and 26 row to 4 10cm in garter st on us 8 5 mm needles after blocking construction notes this shawl is worked from the center top down stitches are increased at each side on every other row to give it its characteristic crescent shape �2 2 directions garter tab row 10 sl1 k3 p to m sm p2tog p12 p2togtbl to m sm p to 4 sts from end k4 with color 1 cast on 3 sts remove markers knit 6 row in garter st
